There seems to be a problem with updating the visibility info based on `_relayPoses`. In `void VisibilityTable::PopulateVisibilityInfo(
  const std::set<ignition::math::Vector3d> &_relayPoses)` ([VisibilityTable.cc:273](#!/osrf/subt/src/7ee55d156f3805553b6ee18c3b9a4602859da5fe/subt_ign/src/VisibilityTable.cc#lines-273)), there's a call to `VisibilityTable::Index`, but that is always returning `std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max()` because `worldSegments` is empty. I believe `worldSegments` is created only when building the LUT, so we need a different way to index relays. I'll try rounding the xyz position as in [VisibilityTable.cc:150](#!/osrf/subt/src/7ee55d156f3805553b6ee18c3b9a4602859da5fe/subt_ign/src/VisibilityTable.cc#lines-150)
